abstracts.cdata!:
The Rehabilitation Loan Project's
            objective is to support the initial phase of the
            government's new stabilization and reform program. The
            program aims to stabilize the economy and promote the
            development of the private sector by reducing fiscal
            deficits, increasing administered prices, controlling credit
            growth, privatizing, liquidating and restructuring state
            enterprises and banking sector reform. The initial phase of
            the loan supported program will have three inter-related
            effects: a) removal of the adverse social consequences from
            increased unemployment; b) reduction of the current
            pressures on banks by politically powerful value-subtracting
            state economic enterprises to finance their losses; and c)
            it will allow the banking system, once rehabilitated, to
            cater to the needs of the emergent private sector. The
            financing provided by this loan will thus directly
            facilitate the government's ability to mitigate the
            social cost of the reform program. The loan will help
            finance the initial cost of the program, which will entail
            additional social safety net expenditures. The loan will be
            disbursed in a single tranche upon effectiveness based on
            the measures already taken by the government.
